availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Isaac Butner (Washington County, KY, blacksmith and soldier (USA))

body.p: Washington County, Kentucky, blacksmith and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Jesse Butner and Rebecca Butner. Blacksmith in Washington County in 1860. Served in the 4th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry (U.S.A.) as a private from January 23, 1864 to November 28, 1864. Killed by guerrillas in Washington County.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Washington County, District 1, p. 205.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 658-59.
KYR-0002-225-0060.
